channel.title: Is it possible to put a bitmap from a string on to a form?
channel.description:
Is it possible to put a bitmap from a string on to a form?
I know you can put images on forms but all the examples I looked at, were getting images from somewhere on the Hard Disk. Is there any way to get the image right from the string? Like if converted a bitmap to a string, set it to a variable, and displayed it from that.
This must be possible.. I hope. :) Thank you.
~Ron

item.title: Is it possible to put a bitmap from a string on to a form?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ron:

Sweet thanks guys. I wonder why people don’t do this? They keep the image in the same folder as the .scar file instead. Which is really annoying. Thanks a lot Bullzeye.

Large bitmaps lag so using a bitmap in a form that is large could cause lag throughout the script running time unless you free the bitmap when you’ve finished using it.

item.title: Is it possible to put a bitmap from a string on to a form?
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Yup it’s possible! I just looked into it.

[scar]program New;
var
YourBMPFromStringHere, FormPic: Integer;
frmDesign : TForm;

procedure loadBMP;
begin
YourBMPFromStringHere := BitmapFromString(12, 9, ‘z78DAA58F410EC0200804BF24’ +
‘462B5CADFEFF4B6DC5D84DA95EBCCCC13083C8E91D7961A07D51C’ +
‘67F72A5322CA587978D0EE7656746DDCE1B77B542DF1E577FC679’ +
‘A4DEA2050E945DB533530B5D7EDC4ED798CDA4B5D00DC05648423’ +
‘C9AD958762FBAE52D1C85E2A7CF86D685428AAD2377472ED4FB89’ +
‘56’);
FormPic:= YourBMPFromStringHere;
end;

procedure SafePaint;
var
Canvas : TCanvas;
begin
Canvas := GetBitmapCanvas(YourBMPFromStringHere);
SafeCopyCanvas(Canvas, frmDesign.Canvas, 0, 0, 500, 500, 0, 0, 500, 500);
end;

procedure PaintForm(Sender:TObject);
begin
SafePaint;
end;

procedure InitForm;
begin
frmDesign := CreateForm;
frmDesign.OnPaint:= @PaintForm;
frmDesign.Left := 250;
frmDesign.Top := 114;
frmDesign.Width := 696;
frmDesign.Height := 480;
frmDesign.Caption := ‘frmDesign’;
frmDesign.Color := clBlack;
frmDesign.Font.Color := clWindowText;
frmDesign.Font.Height := -11;
frmDesign.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
frmDesign.Font.Style := [];
frmDesign.Visible := False;
frmDesign.PixelsPerInch := 96;
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘InitForm’, v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowFormModal’, v);
end;

begin
loadBMP;
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowFormModal;
end.[/scar]

Replace the YourBMPFromStringHere with the name of your bitmap. Oh and change the BitmapFromString procedure to your own BitmapToString… Probably didn’t need to say that
